Adjective: having desirable or positive qualities especially those suitable for a thing specified
having or showing knowledge and skill and aptitude
with or in a close or intimate relationship
most suitable or right for a particular purpose
tending to promote physical well-being; beneficial to health
in good health especially after having suffered illness or injury
wise or advantageous and hence advisable
Adverb: in a most excellent way or manner
from a position of superiority or authority
`good' is a nonstandard dialectal variant for `well'
thoroughly or completely; fully; often used as a combining form
indicating high probability; in all likelihood
(used for emphasis or as an intensifie)
to a suitable or appropriate extent or degree
to a great extent or degree
with great or especially intimate knowledge
with skill or in a pleasing manner
in a manner affording benefit or advantage
without unusual distress or resentment; with good humor
Noun: the supreme effort one can make
the person who is most outstanding or excellent; someone who tops all others
Canadian physiologist (born in the United State)
